definition: board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: How come everyone in our company is middle-aged stuffy?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼我們公司都是一些古板的外年人？

sentences.english: America 's journalists can be a little prudish.
sentences.chinese: 美國的新聞記者可能會有些古板。

sentences.english: My old aunts are very strait-laced.
That girl’s so stiff it looks like rigamortis has set in!
sentences.chinese: 那女孩古板的像個殭屍。

sentences.english: To me he looked to be sixty or seventy and excessively prim.
sentences.chinese: 我看他有六七十歲了，古板之極。

sentences.english: Don't waste your time. Don't you know he's square?
sentences.chinese: 別浪費你的時間了，你不知道他是個老古板嗎？

sentences.english: The Bishops' Bible was read in churches: It was clunky, inelegant.
sentences.chinese: 教堂裏用《主教聖經》，古板枯澀。

sentences.english: The fusty old establishment refused to recognise the demand for popular music.
sentences.chinese: 這一古板的老舊機構拒絕承認人們對流行音樂的需求。

sentences.english: He thought i was a square when i said i loved the truth .
sentences.chinese: 當我說我熱愛真理，他認爲我是個古板守舊的老頑固。

sentences.english: The book is a biting indictment of the US' puritanical values.
sentences.chinese: 該小說是對美國古板的清教價值觀的辛辣控訴。

sentences.english: You have worked at the same job for a year and people call you an "old-timer".
sentences.chinese: 朋友們叫你“老古板”，因爲你在一個地方幹了一年。

sentences.english: My neighbor is a real stick-in-the-mud, and he's only thirty-two.
sentences.chinese: 我的鄰居是個老古板，而且他才三十二歲。

sentences.english: Yeah, my boss is a real stiff.
She had stiffened into a pronounced spinsterhood .
sentences.chinese: 她古板得成了十足的老處女。

sentences.english: The Britsh are too dull to think of anything to talk about.
sentences.chinese: 英國人太古板，都想不出一個可談的話題。

definition: lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
old and decrepit/proud of one's age and experience (idiom)
